summary: The term "secret shopper," a redirect to "mystery shopping," refers to a market research technique employed primarily in the distributive trades sector. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, mystery shopping is utilized to assess compliance with consumer protection laws and quality standards. Regulatory bodies may deploy mystery shoppers to evaluate the adherence of businesses to established guidelines, ensuring fair trading practices and enhancing consumer trust. This method not only aids in monitoring market behavior but also contributes to the enforcement of regulations aimed at safeguarding consumer rights across the EU market.
